general_notes: This plan is designed to help you build muscle, focusing on high-protein nutrition and progressive strength training, while respecting your nut-free dietary restriction. Remember to listen to your body, adjust weights/reps as needed, and ensure proper form. Consistency is key! This plan is a suggestion and should not replace professional medical or dietary advice. Consult with a healthcare professional before starting any new fitness or diet regimen.

meals_list.description: Scrambled eggs (3-4) with spinach, bell peppers, and a side of sliced avocado. Serve with 2 slices of whole-wheat toast.
Grilled chicken breast salad with mixed greens, cucumber, tomatoes, quinoa (1/2 cup cooked), and a light vinaigrette (oil and vinegar based).
Greek yogurt (plain, high-protein) with berries (strawberries, blueberries) and a sprinkle of sunflower seeds (if tolerated for nut-free).
Baked salmon fillet (6-8 oz) with roasted sweet potato (1 medium) and steamed green beans.
Protein shake with water or oat milk.

diet.daily_notes: Focus on consistent protein intake throughout the day to support muscle repair and growth. Stay hydrated.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Control the weight on the way down.

exercises.name: Barbell Bench Press
exercises.notes: Maintain a slight arch in your back.

exercises.name: Bent-Over Dumbbell Rows
exercises.notes: Keep your back straight, squeeze shoulder blades.

exercises.name: Lateral Raises (Dumbbells)
exercises.notes: Focus on shoulder isolation, avoid swinging.

exercises.name: Bicep Curls (Barbell or Dumbbell)
exercises.notes: Full range of motion, squeeze at the top.

exercises.name: Tricep Pushdowns (Cable or Dumbbell)
exercises.notes: Isolate triceps, keep elbows tucked.

exercises.name: Plank
exercises.notes: Engage core, keep body in a straight line.

workout.notes: Focus on controlled movements and progressive overload. Aim to increase weight or reps over time.

meals_list.description: Oatmeal (1 cup dry) cooked with water or oat milk, mixed with 1 scoop protein powder (vanilla/unflavored), and topped with sliced banana.
Turkey and vegetable stir-fry (turkey mince, broccoli, carrots, bell peppers) with brown rice (1 cup cooked). Use soy sauce (or tamari for gluten-free) and ginger for flavor.
Cottage cheese (1 cup) with sliced pineapple.
Lean ground beef (6-7 oz cooked) chili with kidney beans, diced tomatoes, and spices. Serve with a small whole-wheat tortilla.
Greek yogurt (plain, high-protein) with a handful of berries.

diet.daily_notes: Prioritize protein intake at every meal to support muscle synthesis. Drink plenty of water throughout the day.

exercises.name: Barbell Squats
exercises.notes: Focus on depth and maintaining a straight back.

exercises.name: Romanian Deadlifts (Dumbbells or Barbell)
exercises.notes: Feel the stretch in your hamstrings, keep a slight bend in knees.

exercises.name: Leg Press
exercises.notes: Go for a full range of motion without locking knees at the top.

exercises.name: Walking Lunges (Dumbbells)
exercises.notes: Maintain balance, step with purpose.

exercises.name: Hamstring Curls (Machine)
exercises.notes: Slow and controlled movement.

exercises.name: Calf Raises (Standing)
exercises.notes: Pause at the top, feel the squeeze.

workout.notes: Warm up with light cardio for 5-10 minutes. Perform dynamic stretches before and static stretches after your workout.

meals_list.description: Protein pancakes (made with protein powder, egg, and oat flour) with fruit and a drizzle of maple syrup.
Leftover Baked Salmon with a large mixed green salad.
Hard-boiled eggs (2) with an apple.
Chicken and veggie skewers (chicken chunks, bell peppers, onions, zucchini) grilled, served with couscous.

diet.daily_notes: Enjoy your rest day! Focus on nutrient-dense meals and staying active with light activities like walking.

workout.notes: Active recovery day. Consider a leisurely walk, light stretching, or yoga to aid recovery.

meals_list.description: Omelette (3 eggs) with mushrooms, onions, and cheese, served with a side of fruit salad.
Tuna (canned in water) salad (mixed with Greek yogurt or mayo) on whole-wheat bread with lettuce and tomato. Serve with carrot sticks.
Rice cakes (2) with a slice of lean turkey breast.
Baked cod (6 oz) with roasted potatoes and a side of asparagus.

diet.daily_notes: Plan and prepare meals for the upcoming week to ensure consistency with your high-protein, nut-free diet.

workout.notes: Full rest day. Allow your body to fully recover and prepare for the next week's workouts.

meals_list.description: Smoothie: oat milk (1 cup), 1 scoop protein powder, 1 banana, 1/2 cup spinach, 1 tbsp chia seeds (if tolerated for nut-free).
Quinoa bowl with black beans, corn, grilled shrimp (5-6 oz), avocado, and salsa.
Protein bar (ensure nut-free) or a hard-boiled egg.
Shepherd's Pie with lean ground beef, mixed vegetables (peas, carrots), topped with mashed sweet potato.
Cottage cheese (1 cup) with a few slices of peach.

diet.daily_notes: Pre- and post-workout nutrition is important. Ensure you have carbs and protein around your workout time.

exercises.name: Kettlebell Swings
exercises.notes: Explosive movement, focus on hip hinge.

exercises.name: Box Jumps (or Step-ups)
exercises.notes: Land softly, choose an appropriate box height.

exercises.name: Push-ups (or Elevated Push-ups)
exercises.notes: Full range of motion, chest to the floor.

exercises.name: Renegade Rows (Dumbbells)
exercises.notes: Keep core stable, minimize hip rotation.

exercises.name: Mountain Climbers
exercises.notes: Keep core engaged, steady pace.

exercises.name: Battle Ropes (Waves/Slams)
exercises.notes: Focus on power and full body engagement.

workout.notes: This workout blends strength with higher intensity to boost metabolism and improve endurance. Keep rest times short (60-90 seconds).

meals_list.description: Greek yogurt (plain, high-protein) with berries (strawberries, blueberries) and a sprinkle of pumpkin seeds.
Chicken breast (5-6 oz) and roasted vegetable wrap (bell peppers, zucchini, onions) in a whole-wheat tortilla with hummus (ensure nut-free).
Rice cakes (2) with mashed avocado and 'Everything but the Bagel' seasoning.
Lean pork loin (6 oz) with quinoa (1 cup cooked) and a large serving of mixed steamed vegetables (broccoli, cauliflower).
Protein pudding (made with protein powder and a thickener like chia seeds, if tolerated).

diet.daily_notes: Ensure all snacks are nut-free. Focus on a good balance of macros to fuel your second strength day.

exercises.name: Barbell Overhead Press
exercises.notes: Press weight directly overhead, control the eccentric.

exercises.name: Incline Dumbbell Press
exercises.notes: Focus on chest engagement, squeeze at the top.

exercises.name: Pull-ups (or Lat Pulldowns)
exercises.notes: Aim for controlled pull, engage your lats.

exercises.name: Seated Cable Rows
exercises.notes: Pull with your back, not just arms. Squeeze shoulder blades.

exercises.name: Dumbbell Bicep Curls
exercises.notes: Keep elbows close to your body.

exercises.name: Overhead Tricep Extension (Dumbbell)
exercises.notes: Focus on tricep stretch, keep elbows pointing forward.

exercises.name: Face Pulls (Cable or Resistance Band)
exercises.notes: Great for rear delts and posture.

workout.notes: Ensure proper form is maintained throughout. Take adequate rest between sets (60-120 seconds).

meals_list.description: Hard-boiled eggs (2-3) with a medium-sized banana.
Lentil soup with whole-wheat bread on the side.
Apple slices with 2-3 slices of lean deli turkey.
Chicken breast (6 oz) stir-fry with a variety of vegetables (broccoli, carrots, snow peas) and light soy sauce, served with jasmine rice (1 cup cooked).

diet.daily_notes: This is a rest day, but maintain your high-protein intake to support recovery and muscle growth.

workout.notes: Rest day. Focus on recovery, adequate sleep, and nutrition. Light active recovery like walking is optional.
